content:
• Friday, January 9, 2015

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: EHIC +5.7%. BURL +4.3%. ROC +3.7%. NBIX +3.4%. RUSS +3.1%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SEM -4.4%. POZN -2.3%. RUSL -2.1%. EXK -2.1%. MCO -1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • HCA

    HCA lifts 2014 EBITDA guidance

    • HCA +2.6%Â AH after raising guidance for FY 2014 EBITDA to ~$7.4B from an earlier range of $7.25B-$7.35B.
    • HCA says Q4 results will include a $68M increase in Medicaid revenues related to the reversal of the Texas Medicaid Waiver Program adjustment that had been recorded in Q3.
    • Says same-facility admissions rose ~5% in Q4, while same-facility emergency room visits rose ~10.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • BURL

    Burlington Stores +4% on improved guidance

    • Burlington Stores (NYSE:BURL) +4.1% AH after raising guidance for Q4 and the full fiscal year ending Jan. 31.
    • The apparel retailer now sees Q4 EPS of $1.30-$1.32 vs. prior guidance of $1.25-$1.28 and $1.28 analyst consensus estimate, sales growth of 9.6%-10.1% vs. prior guidance for a 7.2%-8.2% gain, and comp-store sales to rise 5%-5.5% vs. guidance for a 3%-4% increase.
    • For the full year, BURL sees EPS of $1.70-$1.72 vs. prior guidance of $1.65-$1.67 and $1.68 analyst consensus, sales growth of 8.2%-8.4% vs. 7.5%-7.8% guidance, and comp-store sales to rise 4.5% vs. guidance of 4%.
    • BURL also says CFO Todd Weyhrich is retiring and that merchandising and IT chief Marc Katz would take the position immediately.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • VIMC

    Vimicro up 40% this week

    • Chinese mixed-signal chipmaker Vimicro (VIMC +14.1%) blasted off this week. Today's gains came on volume (1.4M shares) well above a 3-month daily average of 771K. Shares still only go for 1.3x a sole 2015 sales estimate of $150M (involves a forecast for 51.5% revenue growth).
    • SA author TrinityResearch isn't a fan. Last month, Trinity reported only 18% of Vimicro's announced contracts (in terms of value) could be confirmed on government Web sites, and that contract value was "materially overstated" in three cases. It also highlighted heavy insider selling.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: GDXJ +10.1%. GDX +9.45%. SIVR +4.38%. PSLV +4.36%. SLV +4.33%.
    • Losers: BNO -10.72%. OIL -8.93%. FCG -8.18%. USO -8.1%. AMJ -5.43%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • SIMG

    Silicon Image +6.9%; company reportedly exploring sale

    • Reuters reports Silicon Image (NASDAQ:SIMG) has hired Barclays to explore strategic alternatives, including a potential sale.
    • The report comes a month after SIMG crashed in response to weak 2015 guidance, three weeks after activist Engaged Capital called on the company to buy back shares and cut costs, and four days after it announced it's cutting 45 jobs as part of a restructuring meant to bring about a 13% 2015 drop in opex.
    • Plenty of chipmakers have been acquired or have merged over the last 15 months, thanks to an industry consolidation wave.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • ABGOF

    Abengoa to develop $1.5B plant for Mexico

    • Abengoa (ABGB +4.5%) says it was chosen by Mexico's Federal Electricity Commission to carry out the Norte III project, consisting of a 924 MW combined cycle plant in Ciudad JuÃ¡rez.
    • ABGB says the contract, worth $1.55B, includes engineering, design and construction of the plant as well as 25 years of operation and maintenance.
    • Shares already were rallying after CEO Manuel Sanchez Ortega said theÂ  company would meet its substantial debt repayments next month, but some traders see little more than a short squeeze playing out.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • TSM

    TSMC slumps after Susquehanna warns of share loss

    • The odds of TSMC (TSM -3.1%) losing share with top customer Qualcomm and #3 customer Apple to Samsung have grown, writes Susquehanna's Mehdi Hosseini, citing checks regarding Samsung's 14nm manufacturing process rollout. He maintains a negative rating on TSMC.
    • There have been reports going back to July stating Apple/Qualcomm plan to use Samsung and Globalfoundries' jointly-developed 14nm process. Apple is widely expected to rely on Samsung for at least a part of its A9 CPU production, after tapping TSMC to manufacture the A8. Samsung began producing 14nm chips for an unnamed client (possibly Apple) last month.
    • TSMC, for its part, plans to begin mass-producing 16nm chips in Q2. Its 16nm FinFET Plus process (more advanced than standard 16nm FinFET, has seen stronger customer uptake) entered risk production in November. TSMC claims a 16nm FinFET SoC consume less than half as much power as a similar SoC using its 20nm process.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • ANW

    Aegean expands to Germany, again assuming OW Bunker contracts

    • Aegean Marine Petroleum (OTC:ANW +3.5%) is higher after announcing plans to begin the physical supply and marketing of marine fuels and lubricants to all German ports later this month from a home base in Hamburg, Germany.
    • The new Germany venture will be supported by two chartered-in double-hull bunker tankers previously under charter to the now-defunct OW Bunker; ANW announced last month its new venture into the Gulf of Mexico by similarly taking over contracts for two bunker tankers previously under charter to OW Bunker.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • SYNC

    Synacor up 8.5% on strong volume

    • Synacor (NASDAQ:SYNC) is ending the week on a very strong note. 259K shares have changed hands, well above a 3-month daily average of 119K.
    • The TV Everywhere software provider blasted off last month following bullish remarks from newsletter writer Sid Riggs.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • NTLS

    NTELOS sells off in response to S&P index drop

    • NTELOS (NTLS -5.3%) is close to its 52-week low of $3.85 following news it's getting dropped from the S&P SmallCap 600 after the Jan. 15 close.
    • Shares are down over 80% from a 52-week high of $21.39. FBR argued last month NTELOS could become a takeover candidate for a larger carrier, following its not-well-received decision to pull out of Eastern Virginia.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • INFY

    Infosys rallies after posting earnings, client add growth

    • Though Infosys (INFY +3.6%) missed FQ3 revenue estimates due to forex pressures (while posting in-line EPS), the company still expects 7%-9% FY15 (ends March '15) revenue growth at Sep. 30 exchange rates. Consensus (in absolute dollars) is for 9.1% growth.
    • While Q/Q revenue growth was 2.6% in constant currency, it was only 0.8% in absolute dollars. Gross client adds totaled 59, up from 49 in FQ2 and 54 a year ago. Headcount rose by 13,154 to 169,638.
    • Gross margin rose 260 bps Y/Y to 38.7%, helping EPS meet estimates in spite of the revenue miss. GAAP opex rose 14% to $266M, exceeding revenue growth of 5.6%. Op. margin rose 170 bps to 26.7%.
    • FQ3 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: EDAP +43%. ALXA +37%. ADHD +34%. AGEN +22%. TOPS +20%. PRTO +19%. OTC:DCTH +16%. VIMC +13%. HILL +12%. SCYX +11%.
    • Losers: CNAT -39%. EOPN -38%. ARGS -30%. IDN -28%. ADMP -24%. SBLK -22%. FIVE -18%. VLCCF -17%. CTSO -15%. TESO -15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 2 Comments
  • NBR

    Nabors, Helmerich & Payne cut to Hold from Buy at KeyBanc

    • Nabors Industries (NBR -3.4%) and Helmerich &Â Payne (HP -1.7%) are both downgraded to Hold form Buy at KeyBanc (I, II) following this week's business update from HP, which reveals how quickly and dramatically U.S. rig activity is reacting to the drop in oil prices.
    • The firm expects the impact of a reduced number of working rigs and a drop on spot market dayrates to significantly hurt profitability at the two companies, at least until demand stabilizes; customers are sharply curtailing their drilling programs and releasing rigs as they come off contract.
    • KeyBanc forecasts NBR's contracted rigs in the lower 48 states falling from an average of ~200 in Q4 2014 to 170 in Q1 2015, and to average 155 for full-year 2015.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • FRO

    Frontline soars on reports of demand for floating oil storage

    • Frontline (FRO +10.1%) has now jumped 63% this week amid speculation that a plunge in crude prices is spurring demand for the vessels to store cargoes.
    • “The re-emergence of floating storage is what could move the crude tanker market this year from being rather good to possibly very very good," says a shipping analyst at Pareto Securities in Oslo.
    • Traders may park as much as 60M barrels of oil on tankers in the coming months, according to consulting firm JBC Energy.
    • Among other tanker companies: TK +1.2%, TNK +3.4%, TOO -0.3%, TGP -0.1%, TNP -0.7%, GLNG -1.9%, NAT -0.6%, DHT +3.1%.
    • Earlier: Reuters: Oil glut sparks top traders to book supertankers for storage at sea
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 5 Comments

  • Stocks tumble as bid for oil disappears

    • A quick $2 per barrel dive in the price of oil is hitting the major averages, with the Dow's (DIA -1%) decline the largest in percentage terms. WTI crude is lower by 3% to $47.30 per barrel. USOÂ -2.7%
    • The move in stocks and oil has put a strong bid under Treasurys, with the 10-year yield now lower by a full eight basis points to 1.94%. TLTÂ +0.8%, TBTÂ -1.6%
    • The dollar (UUP, UDN) is enjoying a volatile session - up sharply following the strong headlines out of December's nonfarm payrolls number, but now moderately lower on the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 8 Comments
  • NE

    Noble "the most attractive offshore driller," RBC says

    • Noble Corp. (NE -0.7%) is upgraded to Outperform from Sector Perform with a $19 target price at RBC, which considers NE the most attractive offshore driller due to its solid contract coverage and free cash flow generation in 2015, coupled with a ~10% dividend yield and the potential for upward EPS revisions.
    • At the same time, the firm downgrades Rowan (RDC -3.8%) to Sector Perform from Outperform with a $27 target, noting rapidly deteriorating fundamentals in the jackup market and that WallÂ Street estimates need to come down meaningfully.
    • More broadly, RBC still sees structural weaknesses in the offshore drilling market that will limit upside for the group when oil prices rebound.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 3 Comments
  • KITE

    Money flow into Kite Pharma still bullish

    • Recent IPO Kite Pharma (KITE +8.1%) continues its upward march on double normal volume as CAR-T therapy-stoked investors pile in. Shares have climbed more that 3.5x from mid-August.
    • The current price is 50% above the 50-day EMA so retail investors need to be careful here.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • CTSO

    Cytosorbents off on discounted equity offering

    • Thinly-traded nano cap Cytosorbents (CTSO -15.1%) drops on a 5x surge in volume after it filed a prospectus for a public offering of 1.25M shares of common stock at $8.25 per share.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • INSG

    Novatel up 54% this week

    • Novatel (MIFI +5.6%) has skyrocketed this week to new 52-week highs, and in doing so narrowed its valuation gap relative to larger rival Sierra Wireless. Its 2015E EV/sales ratio, only 0.6x three weeks ago, is closing in on 1.
    • On Wednesday, Novatel unveiled the MT 1200, a 2G/3G mobile telematics product meant for fleet management and usage-based insurance applications (among others). The product comes with a software engine that allows customers to "customize event reporting based on their needs, such as defining geo-fences, setting specific behavior reporting and even enabling or disabling remote starts."
    • Three days ago: M2M plays Sierra, CalAmp down sharply; Novatel surges
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • MDU

    MDU reports $40M more in costs for refining facility, delays Fidelity plan

    • MDUÂ Resources (MDU -3.8%) says it expects the $400M Dakota Prairie refining facility, which it is developing in conjunction with Calumet Specialty Products, to begin commercial production in Q2 after delays due to severe winter weather and revisions to electrical systems.
    • MDU raises the expected cost of the facility to more than $400M, above an earlier estimate of $360M.
    • MDU also says it will delay plans to market its Fidelity E&P business, citing the steep drop in oil prices.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 3 Comments
  • CPRI

    Bumpy start to the year for luxury retail stocks

    • Another tough day for luxury retail stocks as more concerns on pricing trends build up.
    • Consulting firm Bain isn't helping sentiment, noting the luxury sector in China showed negative growth (-1%) for the first time in 2014. An ongoing crackdown by Beijing on corruption is in the background.
    • Michael Kors (KORS -1.7%), Ralph Lauren (RL -2%), Kate Spade (KATE -3.2%), Fossil (FOSL -1%), Vera Bradley (VRA -2%), and Coach (COH -2.2%) are all under-performing market averages.
    • Related stocks: OTCPK:LVMUY, OTC:GUCG, OTCPK:SWGAY, OTCPK:BURBY, EL, RDEN, OTCPK:HESAF, OTCPK:CFRUY, TIF.
    • Related ETFs: PEJ.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • QLIK

    Qlik, Cornerstone slide on Goldman downgrades

    • In addition to cutting Nuance to Sell, Goldman has downgraded Qlik (QLIK -2.7%) and Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD -4.4%) to Neutral. Its targets are respectively $32 and $35.
    • Evercore downgraded Qlik yesterday, but shares rose higher anyway. On Wednesday, Northland hiked its Cornerstone target by $2 to $42, citing "strong 4Q industry checks that we believe indicate the company will report upside to consensus billings estimates." The firm added it thinks "CSOD will be in a stronger competitive position in 2015 that should drive higher realized pricing."
    • Cornerstone reports on Feb. 11, and Qlik on Feb. 12.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • IDN

    Intellicheck down 28.3% after pricing stock offering

    • Intellicheck (NYSEMKT:IDN) is selling 4.86M shares through a public offering at $1.75 apiece - 27% below yesterday's closing price. Underwriters have a 729K-share overallotment option.
    • Gross proceeds are expected to total $8.5M. With Intellicheck's current market cap right around that figure, the company's share count is set to roughly double.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 2 Comments
  • ALXA

    The little guys are running this morning

    • Thinly-traded nano cap Alexza Pharmaceuticals (ALXA +40.2%) jumps on double normal volume. No news accounts for the move other than there is robust buying activity in the biotech nano/micro cap arena.
    • Alexza is far from a star performer. Shares had dropped almost 80% from early 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • TRP

    Keystone XL's Nebraska path cleared by court, decision shifts to Obama

    • The Nebraska Supreme Court issues a reversal of a lower court ruling that had blocked a route for the Keystone XL pipeline, leaving in place legislation that favored TransCanada's (TRP +3.2%) claim to build the pipeline across the state.
    • The ruling ends the legal challenge to a Nebraska law that allowed the Republican governor to determine the route of the pipeline in the state.
    • The project’s fate now returns to Pres. Obama, who has cited the lawsuit in deferring a decision on approving the project.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM | 9 Comments
  • TCEHY

    JD.com, Tencent investing $1.55B in Bitauto

    • Chinese mobile messaging/gaming giant Tencent (OTCPK:TCEHY) and leading direct online retailer JD.com (JD +0.8%) are directly investing $1.3B in "cash and resources" in major auto site Bitauto (BITA +8.7%), and $250M in Bitauto's YiXin Capital (online auto financing) subsidiary.
    • JD will directly invest $400M in cash in Bitauto and provide $750M in resources, including "exclusive access to the new and used car channels on JD.com's e-commerce sites including mobile apps and additional support from its key platforms," in exchange for shares. Tencent will directly invest $150M in cash. JD and Tencent will respectively invest $100M and $150M in YiXin Capital.
    • The deal will leave JD with a 25% stake in Bitauto, and Tencent a 3.3% stake. JD and Tencent will respectively have 17.7% and 26.6% stakes in YiXin Capital. Tencent already has a sizable stake in JD.
    • Bitauto, whose shares have soared on the news, promises to "aggressively invest to solidify Bitauto's industry leadership and build market share" in upcoming months. Rival Autohome (ATHM +5.8%) is also up sharply, perhaps on hopes a Tencent/JD rival (Alibaba?) will invest in the company in response.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 2 Comments
  • AF

    Astoria Financial and Webster Financial slump after downgrades

    • Guggenheim loses patience with Buy calls on Astoria Financial (AF -2.9%) and Webster Financial (WBS -1.8%), downgrading both to Neutral.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • BAH

    Booz Allen boosted by two-notch upgrade at BAML

    • Bank of America gets with the plan on Booz Allen Hamilton (BAH +2.7%) upgrading from Underperform all the way to Buy after a nice run for the stock - up nearly 50% over the past year.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • SBUX

    Starbucks volatile on COO development

    • Reports indicate the departure of Starbucks (SBUX -1.3%) COO Troy Alstead is due to a personal issue which has been under discussion for some time.
    • The Puget Sound Business Journal suggests it's "unlikely" Alstead will return to the company.
    • Alstead nearly left the company in 2008 before CEO Howard Schultz talked him into staying.
    • Several analysts have tipped that the dip in shares makes for a good entry point on Starbucks, although SA contributor Howard Penney has a detailed look on the company which could give some investors pause.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM
  • NUAN

    Nuance down 4% on Goldman downgrade

    • "We do not see NUAN as a potential acquisition candidate, and see growth and margins challenged," writes Goldman's Greg Dunham, downgrading the voice recognition software/services giant to Sell.
    • Goldman's LBO model suggests a -1% IRR for a Nuance LBO under its base-case scenario, compared with a 20% IRR for enterprise software vendors CommVault and Informatica.
    • The WSJ reported back in June Nuance had talked with Samsung and P-E firms about a potential sale. Speculation that Carl Icahn would push the company to sell itself has been around for some time.
    • Shares have made new 52-week lows. They now go for ~3x estimated FY15 (ends Sep. '15) EV/sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM | 4 Comments
  • SBLK

    Star Bulk Carriers slides after pricing secondary

    • Star Bulk Carriers (NASDAQ:SBLK) announces it upsized a secondary public offering to 49M common shares.
    • The offering is priced at $5.00 per share.
    • Funds are earmarked in part by the company for a newbuilding program.
    • SBLK -18.4% premarket to $5.33.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • SD

    SandRidge Energy +11.5% following quarterly results

    • SandRidge Energy (NYSE:SD) +11.5% premarket after finally releasing FQ3 earnings following several months of discussions with the SEC, and filing restated quarterly results for the past two years after the SEC questioned its accounting practices.
    • FQ3 results beat Wall Street expectations after reporting unadjusted net income of $0.30/share vs. a $0.20 loss for the year-ago quarter.
    • SD says it is already reducing 2015 capex levels from 2014's $1.55B as well as its rig count, and expects to announce its 2015 spending plans next month.
    • SD has a fully undrawn borrowing base of $1.2B with a current facility of $900M, total long-term debt is sitting at $3.2B, and it holds $590M in cash, leaving net debt at $2.6B.
    • Says its Mid-Continent drilling program continues to generate commercial returns, even at current commodity prices; in the first nine months of 2014, 81% of SD's capex went to this region.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 11 Comments
  • YELP

    Yelp up 3.5% on BofA/Merrill upgrade

    • Citing valuation, BofA/Merrill has upgraded YELP to Buy, albeit while cutting its target by $12 to $70. "Our positive view on Yelp is based on its position as a local category leader with a strong position on mobile, enviable engagement trends and strong viral attributes."
    • BofA's target is equal to 44x estimated 2016 EPS and 26x estimated EV/EBITDA. Going into today, Yelp was down 47% from an early-2014 high of $101.75.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM
  • CROX

    Crocs lower after downgrade

    • Crocs (NASDAQ:CROX) is downgraded to Neutral from Overweight by Piper Jaffray.
    • The investment firm cites concerns on Crocs' Asia inventory and leans on channel checks on the retailer's traffic and pricing.
    • CROX -2.7% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • ARGSQ

    Argos HIV immunotherapy candidate fails in clinical trial

    • Thinly-traded micro cap Argos Therapeutics (ARGS) is offÂ 35%Â premarket albeit on turnover of only 2,105 shares. The company hosts a conference call this morning to present data on AGS-004, a fully personalized immunotherapy for the treatment of HIV infection. A Phase 2b study evaluating the safety and efficacy of AGS-004 in chronically infected HIV patients failed to achieve its primary endpoint of a 1.1 Log lower median viral load after 12 weeks of interruption of antiretroviral therapy in the treatment group versus placebo.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: AGEN +27%. EDAP +16%. PTLA +13%. SD +10%. INFY +7%.
    • Losers: CNAT -41%. EOPN -39%. IDN -33%. ADMP -25%. SBLK -19%. FIVE -15%. CTSO -13%. GMLP -8%. SAN -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 4 Comments

  • Canada jobs numbers disappoint again

    • Canada shed 4.3K jobs in December vs. expectations for a 15K gain and a loss of 10.7K in November. The unemployment rate held steady at 6.6%.
    • It's the first back-to-back job losses since mid-2009 when the economy was mired in a deep recession.
    • The loonie (NYSEARCA:FXC) takes out new multi-year lows following the number, nowÂ down 0.3%Â at $0.8424.
    • ETFs: EWC, CNDA, EWCS, FCAN, QCAN
    • Previously: Unemployment rate in U.S. tumbles to 5.6% (Jan. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM | 9 Comments
  • AYI

    More on Acquity brands' FQ1

    • Acuity Brands (NYSE:AYI) reportsÂ a 14% increase in volume helped drive sales higher.
    • Gross margin rate rose 90 bps to 42.2%.
    • Adjusted operating margin rate grew 230 bps 14.9%.
    • Sales of LED-based products rose by more than 70%.
    • AYIÂ +0.92%Â premarket.
    • FQ1 results
     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM
  • AGEN

    Agenus up big premarket on news of alliance

    • Agenus (NASDAQ:AGEN) jumpsÂ 30%Â premarket on robust volume in response to its partnership with Incyte. No premarket trades for (NASDAQ:INCY) are reported.
    • Previously: Incyte and Agenus team up to develop immunotherapeutics (Jan. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • FCSC

    Fibrocell up premarket

    • Thinly-traded nano cap Fibrocell Science (NASDAQ:FCSC) is upÂ 65%Â premarket albeit on only 1,200 shares. No news is available that accounts for the move. Retail investors need to exercise caution here.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM
  • CERE

    Ceres +37% on favorable results from biotech corn evaluations in China

    • Ceres (NASDAQ:CERE) +37.5% premarket after reporting its multi-gene combinations in corn achieved a ~25% yield advantage over controls in many of its research-scale field evaluations involving two different hybrids.
    • CERE says a second year of field trials in China demonstrated significant yield advantages under normal and drought conditions.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM

  • Modest gain for futures after jobs number

    • A bit lower ahead of the jobs number, stock index futures have turned modestly higher after the print beat expectations, and prior moths' revisions were strong. SPYÂ +0.2%Â premarket
    • Long-dated Treasurys are looking past the headlines though, and maybe eyeing falling labor force participation and lower wages as the 10-year yield slides three basis points to 1.99%.
    • Also down ahead of the print, the dollar (NYSEARCA:UUP) has shot higher across the board.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • CNAT

    Conatus off big premarket

    • Nano cap Conatus Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CNAT) cratersÂ 43%Â premarket on robust volume in response to apparent uncertainty in its Phase 2 results evaluating its oral pan-caspase protease inhibitor, emricasan, in patients with acute-on-chronic liver failure ((ACLF)). In data presented during its conference call yesterday after the close, only the highest dose (50 mg BID) of emricasan demonstrated sustained lowering of cCK18 over the entire dosing period in the majority of patients. This suggests that higher doses of the drug need to be explored. Caspase-cleaved cytokeratin 18 (cCK18) is a biomarker of caspase activity and inflammation.
    • Analysts were apparently shaken over the data. Piper, for example, lowered its price target from $16 to $6.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM | 5 Comments
  • AYI

    Acuity Brands EPS of $1.32

    • Acuity Brands (NYSE:AYI): FQ1 EPS of $1.32.
    • Revenue of $647.4M (+12.7% Y/Y) beats by $8.02M.
    • Shares +1.06% PM.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • PENX

    More on Penford's FQ1

    • Penford (NASDAQ:PENX)Â reports gross margin rate rose 233 bps Q/Q and 771 bps Y/Y to 17.51%.
    • Adjusted operating margin rate increased 85 bps Q/Q and 468 bps Y/Y to 6.18%.
    • Segment sales: Food ingredients: $34.16M (+5.62% Q/Q and +19.23% Y/Y); Industrial ingredients: $69.47M (-9.47% Q/Q and -13.80% Y/Y).
    • Segment gross profit:Â Food ingredients: $10.96M (+121 bps Q/Q and -30 bps Y/Y to 32.07%); Industrial ingredients: $7.19M (+178 bps Q/Q and 857 bps Y/Y to 10.35%).
    • Segment operating income:Â Food ingredients: $6.89M (+164 bps Q/Q and -261 bps Y/Y to 20.18%); Industrial ingredients: $2.98M (+83 bps Q/Q to 4.29%).
    • FQ1 results
     
     
     
     
    | 8:00 AM
  • SAN

    Santander gives more ground following capital raise

    • More than half of the €7.5B in newly issued Santander (NYSE:SAN) stock was purchased by U.S. investors, reports the FT, with about 25% bought by U.K. owners.
    • The bank issued 1.214B shares at Â£6.18 each as new executive chairman Ana Botin quickly broke ranks with her late father's strategy just four months after replacing him atop the company.
    • The ADRs are lower by 4.5%Â premarket after yesterday's 7% decline.
    • Now that Santander has joined Deutsche Bank in raising capital, analysts turn their attention to the next dominoes.
